content: What 19th-century French author wrote the science fiction classics "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea" and "Journey to the Center of the Earth"?

The 19th-century French author who wrote the science fiction classics "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea" and "Journey to the Center of the Earth" is Jules Verne. He was born on February 8, 1828, in Nantes, France, and is often referred to as the "Father of Science Fiction." Verne's works are known for their detailed descriptions of scientific concepts and their imaginative depictions of future technologies. His books have inspired countless scientists, inventors, and writers, and continue to be popular worldwide.
